the earlier comment is not really a delusional thing on my part i think, that's basically what the plot seems to set up. if it's trying to make iota of sense at least, which is does seem to be trying to do ( it's a bit annoying to discuss all the other specific possibilities, with the word limit and not being able to edit comments but they all basically lead to more or less similar conclusions)

In the first place this story itself is already pretty delusional, somehow even more than if she was just a normal human maid.(which i always thought was peak wish-fulfillment, but i guess i just wasn't desperate enough)

it'd be much better if it was just a simple story based on reika and the boy rather than this weirdo, soul mate fetishistic immortal f*ck spirit thing
and i guessed that reika is reiji's mom because reiji looks exactly like the old reika ( and if she wasn't that'd be the most stupid coincidence in the world)
the twin personalities idea is nonsense though, 

still, amazing fap

i mean technically, it's unlikely that current reika was sexually "trained" by the father, at least if you consider the information given to us about the father and how reika herself works. It's more likely that reika was only taught (told) what to do with fully serving his son as his maid, and reika just quickly became experienced when dealing with reiji himself.
she did fully "serve" the father, but she was in a different form and presumably in a faithful relationship similar to the one current reiji has, and that reika also seems to have given birth to reiji himself.
the father, before dying told her how to take care of his son and then died
that is the only thing the current reika remembers of the dad and everything before about her relationship with him and the person she was then is forgotten.
it'd be pretty unfaithful and weird for dad to lay his hands on the new, basically totally different reika, especially as he seemed to have loved the old and different reika a lot

Yes, she was handed down by his father.  In page 20, she says that she has been "taught" by his father.

Out of all the possible weird twists they could've gone with (i.e. Reika is Reiji's mom or his twin sister made into a robot or some other shit), making her a spirit of servitude with dual personalities (and locked memories) that are triggered by music ...is a weird one. Well, okay, I guess. Kind of a meaningless revelation if you ask me.
